WVHI (1330am): Evansville, IN, 5-7pm WMTL (870am): Leitchfield, 11am-1pm WRIL (106.3fm): Middlesboro, Thur 8-10pm WWTF (1580am): Lexington, 4-6pm Article written by Mrs. Tyler Thompson No, I will not make you a sandwich, but you can follow me on Twitter @MrsTylerKSR or email me . 82 responses to “BOMANI JONES will come on KSR to talk about the UofL scandal (Monday Show Thread)” UK_JB October 5, 2015 at 9:48 am | Permalink | Reply

NO, I am not a troll. Let’s get that established first and out of the way! I watched U of L beat NC State on Saturday. I then went and watched the EKU game in Commonwealth Stadium. The only relative stat would be that NCState beat EKU 35-0, although that is not the point of this post, just an interesting tidbit. What I would like to make a point of in this post, however, is that what I saw out of Louisville’s play vs NCState is that if we’re talking like we’re wanting to chalk this one up as an “easy win”, then the next day is going to be a sad day to be a Cats fan. If we play as flat vs UL as we did vs EKU, it’ll be another UL win again this year. CatFanDu October 5, 2015 at 10:19 am | Permalink | Reply 
There is NO WAY the guys can keep the THIS show mature, it can’t happen. Adult (as in adult theater) maybe, but there are just too many opportunities to be “locker room”. CATandMONKEY October 5, 2015 at 10:23 am | Permalink

That’s what I meant. This show will be Great! I was only commenting on the lead-in to the show where Matt said it was going to be an “Adult Oriented Show, tell the kids there is no pod cast, etc.) with a little sarcasm. Chill dude, and realize who is and who is not a Card Troll! CATandMONKEY October 5, 2015 at 10:44 am | Permalink 
Hey man, we are all good…or well, should we speak properly. I perhaps jumped the gun thinking you were one of our more conservative fans. Never a Card tought in my mind. Peace, and apologies! CATandMONKEY October 5, 2015 at 10:45 am | Permalink

Forde broke the story when he did because he is friends with louisville athletics and wanted to break the news when it would do the least damage – going into the weekend where talk shows have to wait 2 days to start carving up the story. Big Mike In the Wood October 5, 2015 at 10:32 am | Permalink 
Yep break it on Friday while everyones turning their attention to the weekend and college football distractions. WildWillie October 5, 2015 at 10:35 am | Permalink 
Right on.That’s what I was getting at.He is a lapdog for Jurich and Pitino. CATandMONKEY October 5, 2015 at 10:35 am | Permalink 
Unlike most politically embarrassing stories that utilize this same media tactic, this story kept its legs throughout the weekend and apparently will only grow in scope until such time that either Louisville can legitimately refute all the allegations (not happening) or even more sordid details add more nails to the Crypt Keeper’s coffin. 
I actually almost wish that Rick had no knowledge of this situation. Regardless, it happened under his watch. Based on the themes of his numerous books, Rick MUST take responsibility. J-Dub421 October 5, 2015 at 10:51 am | Permalink 
That woman has way too much information that can be corroborated for this to be made up. She has photos and hundreds of text messages. There should also be a paper trail from the money that should be easy enough to find. ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 10:51 am | Permalink 
All the butthurt Cal haters ever say is that even if Cal was not responsible for th43e cheating at his two former posts, he was the man in charge and MUST take responsibility for both infractions. Therefore he is a cheater. The same could be said for Pitino… but i bet they will disagree… BigBlueBoom October 5, 2015 at 11:03 am | Permalink 
Ukjaybrat….so you’re saying Cal is a cheater and he and our fanbase must take responsibility for his infractions? If not, then I assume you feel Pitino should also have no liability in this issue. ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 11:11 am | Permalink 
No I am saying that Louisville fans will absolutely use a double standard when it comes to this. 
But to answer your question more specifically. I think What Rose did was not under Cal’s control. He may or may not have cheated on his SAT, that fact was never proven. And he was not told before the season started that he would be ineligible. It wasn’t until after the season that Rose was found to be ineligible. So none of that had anything to do with Cal, that sucks. 
And the in Camby situation, Cal found out what happened and turned himself in. Anyone that would cheat just to turn himself in is just dumb. 
This situation isn’t somebody cheating on a test or taking money from a recruit. This is underage kids having sex and drinking “IN THE DORMS.” I don’t care if he knew or not, what happens in your players dorms *should* be your responsibility. If it happened in a dirty hotel off campus, that’s not something you can really police. But in the dorm? Realme October 5, 2015 at 10:28 am | Permalink | Reply 
So what does the show thread think the consequences should be? I think Pitino should resign, I think there should be NCAA sanctions, but I would rather not see the title vacated. The players that had nothing to do with this stuff don’t deserve to have their accomplishments removed, IMO. Crushgroove October 5, 2015 at 10:33 am | Permalink 
No way. It’s Louisville. They deserve the full brunt of damage. ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 10:30 am | Permalink | Reply 
i just think it’s ridiculous that louisville radio is ignoring the implications of all of this and attacking the credibility of the escort… ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 10:32 am | Permalink 
i mean, yeah! … she’s a hooker. and she roped her kids into the family business… but just because she’s a terrible person doesn’t mean she went through all the trouble to make up a story this disgusting and fake all of that “evidence” just because.. wait, what would be her motive to throw Louisville basketball under the bus again ? Crushgroove October 5, 2015 at 10:34 am | Permalink 
Can’t wait to hear Underdogs today. The disappointment in Tony’s voice will be worth all the denial and deflection. CATandMONKEY October 5, 2015 at 10:48 am | Permalink

Victim blaming is prevalent in society today. Look at all the hate hurled at Jameis Winston’s accuser. WildWillie October 5, 2015 at 10:31 am | Permalink | Reply 
I really don’t believe in things like vacating titles and final fours and such.However,in this case it would be hilarious if U of L had to vacate their NCAA title and FF appearance. ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 10:40 am | Permalink 
the funny thing is, i wonder how many decent recruits they actually turned away because of all this. apparently the only “good” player that they recruited was Montrezl. Did the rest of them think “ehy this is pretty shady, i don’t want to play for this organization.” Nathan October 5, 2015 at 10:32 am | Permalink | Reply

Nathan, the apple doesn’t fall from the tree. If Momma has the moral compass to peddle other people’s flesh, she’d have no problem’s feeding off of her own. Sad… chris gettelfinger is not walking through that door October 5, 2015 at 10:32 am | Permalink | Reply

Anyway, I had enough Saturday, and as much as I like to laugh at UL, this one’s tougher for me, mostly because the woman allegedly had her daughters involved. Realme October 5, 2015 at 10:56 am | Permalink | Reply

I think the alumni associate would also force our AD to resign. As much as I like Cal and Barnhart, the program is bigger than any individuals. That’s what UL should do as well, stop the bleeding, work with the NCAA, take your medicine, clean up the mess, and move on with some dignity. ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 11:14 am | Permalink 
@topten that google search is based on opinions of people that probably mostly don’t even know the facts of either of the incidents that happened… not facts. There are actual basketball coaches that have actually cheated, been caught and punished that people think are “not as big of a cheater” than cal… which based on facts, is stupid… but ya know, trolls gone troll… Realme October 5, 2015 at 11:16 am | Permalink 
Topten, see Jay’s response viii to question 13. He took apart your silly deflection very well, so no need for me to say anything. Now lets talk about your program’s shocking lack of shame or morality. J-Dub421 October 5, 2015 at 11:24 am | Permalink 
Topten, that is the perception of idiots with no actual proof. Pitino has been in trouble with the NCAA before, when he was an assistant at Hawaii. Pitino was personally implicated. Look it up if you don’t believe me. 
Coack K, Dean Smith, and Roy Williams are all considered to be great coaches and not at all dirty, but that’s mostly because the NCAA refuses to really investigate allegations at Duke or UNC. Corey Maggette took money from a booster and Lance Thomas paid $30,000 in cash for jewelry at Duke, but nothing happened because the NCAA doesn’t want to tarnish Coach K’s image. UNC committed 18 years of mass scale academic fraud, and nothing is being done. The NCAA picks and chooses what to enforce. Booby Petrino October 5, 2015 at 10:57 am | Permalink | Reply 
Listening to Card fans try to dispute the allegations is funnier than the actual allegations. “Those pictures are all black and white, and they are just sitting around doing nothing”…yeah Card fans, bc you expected her to have sex selfies? “We recruited better players and didn’t get them, if we were offering all this we would’ve gotten some of those players”…yeah bc a player who knows he can stay out of trouble and go one-and-done is gonna give all that up to hang with prostitutes and be stuck in Louisville four years. “Some of those screen shots of texts look photoshopped”…yeah I’m sure the hooker is proficient in photo shop, maybe Drew taught her. ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 11:03 am | Permalink 
what they fail to address in all of this, is what motivation would a simple hooker have to fake all of this evidence and story just to blow up a basketball team? KT October 5, 2015 at 11:01 am | Permalink | Reply

It’s sad and I kind of hope they prove me wrong but I’m not holding my breath at this point. ukjaybrat October 5, 2015 at 11:05 am | Permalink 
winning fixes everything… except STDs houndstooth October 5, 2015 at 11:09 am | Permalink | Reply

It is taught as being subjective and relativist. That’s why an ethics professor at a state school can look at hiring Petrino as being fine. houndstooth October 5, 2015 at 11:23 am | Permalink

Matt and Ryan. Do you think it’s possible the recruits didn’t know? You all keep referencing that the recruits didn’t need prostitutes to get laid, but these situations were probably set up without the recruits knowing that they were about to hook up with prostitutes.
